timeline.bodyText:
I have plaved the helper under the package com.microsoft.azure.sdk.iot.pnphelpers: https://github.com/Azure/azure-iot-sdk-java/blob/abmisr/thermostat/pnp/src/main/java/com/microsoft/azure/sdk/iot/pnphelpers/PnpHelper.java
What do you think of this as the folder/ package structure?
I would rather not have the word "samples" in the package and folder path.
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText:
Don't forget to include the log4j.properties file for this new sample so that users who run it can easily get logs from the SDK. The other other samples each have a resources folder that you can copy to do that

Let me take a look at that. Thanks. Will reach out if I have any questions.
replies.author: vinagesh

replies.bodyText:
I have plaved the helper under the package com.microsoft.azure.sdk.iot.pnphelpers: https://github.com/Azure/azure-iot-sdk-java/blob/abmisr/thermostat/pnp/src/main/java/com/microsoft/azure/sdk/iot/pnphelpers/PnpHelper.java
What do you think of this as the folder/ package structure?
I would rather not have the word "samples" in the package and folder path.

I think it is a good idea to get rid of the samples as we discussed that this might be released separately. And we can use the pnp-helper for the module name. I believe your change will go in first so make those changes and I can rebase. I'll just add my helper functions to that.
replies.author: vinagesh

timeline.bodyText:
nit: this can also be done in a single statement:
return Collections.singleton(new Pair(properyName, propertyValue));
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra
